intro: Artabotrys zeylanicus var. zeylanicus, commonly known as the fragrant white flower or Malabar star. It is a tropical evergreen shrub native to the Indian subcontinent, characterized by its aromatic, star-shaped white flowers. The plant belongs to the Annonaceae family and is known for its fragrant blooms that emit a sweet, spicy scent. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has glossy, elliptical leaves. The flowers are often used in traditional medicine and as ornamental plants due to their beauty and fragrance.
